wiki.text:
In gambling, 'snake eyes' is the outcome of rolling the dice in a game and
getting only one pip on each die. The pair of pips resembles a pair of eyes,
which is appended to the term 'snake' because of the long-standing association
of this word with treachery and betrayal. The dictionary of etymology traces
that use of the term back to 1929,<ref
name="ref1">[http://www.etymonline.com/index.php?l=s&p=28 Online Etymology
Dictionary]</ref> although it may be traced all the way back to the ancient
Roman dice games, where 'Dogs' represented two ones. They referred to this as
"the dog throw". In modern parlance, it refers to such a roll in any game
involving dice. Snake eyes also refers to looking one way and passing the ball
the other way in the game of Taps.
wiki.title: snake eyes
